oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pickard Family Performance P-F R-C & P-F R-D
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 2 of 7. Two recordings of the Pickard Family (performance group) from the thirteenth day of an unknown month in 1937. Sessions are labeled as P-F R-C side 2 and P-F R-D side 2 respectively and recorded in Mexico.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pickard Family
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) [Unknown instrumental jew's harp song] (Pickard Family) -- (01:02) Obed Pickard, Charlie Pickard and Ruthie Pickard joke about the jew's harp -- (01:51) Abdul A-Bull-Bull-Amir (Pickard Family) -- (04:11) Charlie, Ruthie and Obed joke about yodeling -- (04:44) Sweet Fern (Pickard Family) -- (07:10) Charlie and Obed joke about a sweet girl (07:35) Commercial for Peruna performed by Dad -- (09:00) [Unidentified Harmonica Tune] (Pickard Family) -- (09:42) The Pickard Family introduces Old MacDonald Had a Farm-- (09:54) Old MacDonald Had A Farm (Pickard Family) -- (12:13) The Old Songs that Live Forever (Pickard Family) [featuring Peruna radio spot by Don] -- (13:46) [Piano Duet] (Pickard Family) -- (14:00) Charlie and Ruthie talk about a poem wrote for their father and Don gives his appreciation for his home town -- (15:23) Dad's Narrative (Pickard Family) -- (17:35) Charlie, Don, and Ruthie appreciate the poem and joke about fooling fish -- (18:22) Commercial for Peruna performed by Don -- (19:58) Corinna, Corinna [Instrumental] (Pickard Family) -- (20:21) Ruthie, Charlie, and Ruthie joke about an obituary -- (21:19) The Poor Married Man (Pickard Family) -- (24:10) Bub, Ruthie and Charlie joke about being single and pronouncing a Hawaiian Princess' name-- (25:05) Aloha Oe (Pickard Family) -- (27:02) Dad thanks Charlie and Bub for the song (27:14) It's the Old Songs that Live Forever (Pickard Family)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Pickard Family (MusicalGroup)
